item.title: CDL profiles AIDS History Project
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description:
Through its newsletter CDL “highlights new collections on Calisphere that feature community voices and stories. These collections are made available in close collaboration with local community members and broaden our worldview through the diverse narratives and myriad perspectives that resonate in the collections. Spotlight on the AIDS History Project The UCSF Archives & ...

Read moreCDL profiles AIDS History Project

item.title: User Services and Accessioning Archivist position open
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description:
Archives & Special Collections just posted a full-time, one year User Services and Accessioning Archivist position: http://tiny.ucsf.edu/sAOGYX . The User Services and Accessioning Archivist performs all aspects of archival operations. Utilizing archival best practices and standards independently accessions, processes and catalogues archival and manuscripts collections, prepares finding aids, performs basic ...

Read moreUser Services and Accessioning Archivist position open

item.title: New position in Archives: Digital Archivist (1-year temporary)
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description:
We are existed to announce that we have a new temporary associate librarian position open: Digital Archivist. For the full description, please see: https://aprecruit.ucsf.edu/apply/JPF01013.  Please feel free to share that description with anyone you think might be qualified and interested.  To ensure full consideration by the search committee, apply by ...

item.title: Great Team Work!
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description:
The UCSF Library is collaborating with four medical libraries on a project to digitize and make publicly accessible through the Medical Heritage Library (MHL) old state medical journals. The MHL, a digital resource on the history of medicine and health developed by an international consortium of cultural heritage repositories, has ...

Read moreGreat Team Work!

item.title: Can the Internet be archived?
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description: Jill Lepore wonders “Can the Internet be Archived?” in the latest issue of The New Yorker (January 26, 2015) in which she profiles the work of Brewster Kahle, founder of the Internet Archive and inventor of the Wayback Machine, as well as describes how it’s been used by archivists.

item.title: Welcome Kelsi Evans to the Archives & Special Collections
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description:
As you all know in 2014-2015 the UCSF is celebrating its 150th anniversary. Our new Assistant Research Archivist, Kelsi Evans will help with research and organization for several onsite and online exhibits, as well as processing, cataloging, digitization, and social media projects related to the University sesquicentennial. She will respond ...

Read moreWelcome Kelsi Evans to the Archives & Special Collections

item.title: Welcome back, Kate!
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description:
Kate Tasker is returning to UCSF Archives & Special Collections to work on a project processing the Eric Berne Papers. After completing the Robert L. Day Collection project with UCSF last May, Kate spent the summer at San Francisco State University arranging and describing the papers of SFSU Professor Paul K. Longmore. ...

Read moreWelcome back, Kate!

item.title: Welcome Jesse Chairez to the Archives and Special Collections!
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description:
Please join me in welcoming our new intern Jesse Chairez . He decided to do his History Internship in the UCSF Archives. This internship program is designed to be an opportunity for undergraduate history majors to learn about the many ways that history is practiced “in the real world.” Jesse ...

item.title: Archives: New Intern
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description:
Please join me in welcoming the new Archives and Special Collections intern, René  Radusky! She will be working in the Archives reading room on Fridays during the fall semester, starting tomorrow, August 23rd.   While learning archival theory and practice, René  will be contributing to further advancement of our oral history program and ...

item.title: Welcome Bijan Esfahani to the Archives and Special Collections!
item.dc:creator: Polina Ilieva
item.description:
Please join me in welcoming our new volunteer Bijan Esfahani. Bijan – MLS AHIP – is currently volunteering to assist with the inventory and finding aids of the Northern California Nevada Medical Library Group (NCNMLG) collections. Based in the South Bay, he serves as a faculty librarian at Evergreen College ...
